meaningMnemonic: When it's <radical>spring</radical> in <radical>heaven</radical> they <kanji>play music</kanji>. To your mortal, human ears it sounds more like snow melting, birds chirping, and plants waking up.
readingMnemonic: In heaven, the ones that <kanji>play music</kanji> are the <reading>sou</reading>ls (そう) of the dead. They have a huge band up there, and even though it just seems like normal spring sounds to you, up there in heaven when the souls play music it's more like a huge, 100-part band!
